qas.question: Where did the first semi-permanent residents of the Antarctic area live?
What was the profession of the residents of South Georgia?
In what year did the sealers start staying on South Georgia?
What was the nationality of most whalers?
When did explorer Carl Anton Larsen become a British citizen?
Who were the first permenat residents of regions near Antarctica?

plausible_answers.text: Grytviken, Leith Harbour, King Edward Point, Stromness, Husvik, Prince Olav Harbour, Ocean Harbour and Godthul

qas.question: What settlements were established on Antarctica?

plausible_answers.text: Grytviken, Leith Harbour, King Edward Point, Stromness, Husvik, Prince Olav Harbour, Ocean Harbour and Godthul

qas.question: What did Captain Anon Carl Larsen found?

context: The first semi-permanent inhabitants of regions near Antarctica (areas situated south of the Antarctic Convergence) were <b5_0><b10_0>British and American <a1_0>sealers<b10_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> who used to spend a year or more on <a0_0>South Georgia<a0_0/>, from <a2_0><b6_0>1786<b6_0/><a2_0/> onward. During the <b11_0>whaling era<b11_0/>, which lasted until 1966, the population of that island varied from over 1,000 in the summer (over 2,000 in some years) to some 200 in the winter. Most of the whalers were <a3_0><b7_0>Norwegian<b7_0/><a3_0/>, with an increasing proportion of Britons. The settlements included <b8_0><b12_0>Grytviken, Leith Harbour, King Edward Point, Stromness, Husvik, Prince Olav Harbour, Ocean Harbour and Godthul<b12_0/><b8_0/>. Managers and other senior officers of the whaling stations often lived together with their families. Among them was the founder of <b13_0>Grytviken<b13_0/>, <b9_0><b14_0>Captain Carl Anton Larsen<b14_0/><b9_0/>, a prominent Norwegian whaler and explorer who, along with his family, adopted British citizenship in <a4_0>1910<a4_0/>.
